column4: what is a simple gui tool to make a ntfs partition automount on boot?
you can add a line to /etc/fstab to make the partition mount at boot
or create a script to run the mount command when you log in
- thanks, but i am looking for a SIMPLE tool, i already had, and forgot the package name
apt-cache search ntfs
i'd just use fstab, it will then be mounted even if you dro pto osafe mode root console
- already doing this... for over 40 minutes now, also google of course. that package had some cryptic name - i lost my ubuntu-notes.txt file due to my stupidity
- i had problems making it manually
- the tool writes all the stuff to fstab
ive not come across it but you can use apt-search to see whats on the repos if you search intelligently, you can even grep the output
try: apt-cache search disk | grep -i tool
- thanks for your attention. i give up and will try tweaking fstab manually. it is a new computer, maybe it will work here...
backup the original first so you can easily roll back
- okok... luckily, i am just lazy and not a total newbie
i assume nothing in here, no offence meant
- misunderstanding! i just would like the easy-click-and-go version
i dont know of such an app, i always manually update fstab
if you know the command to mount it at command line, the fstab entry is very little different
but his route says: link-local      *               255.255.0.0     U     1000   0        0 eth2
I know, what modem it is, but I did not find anything on google so far. Just a general question: Do I need some sort of pppd stuff?
what am I looking for??
what program would I tell about the hardware?
ah, that sounds reasonable. Reading the linked page. Thx.

sorry for being in "noob" mode, I am in a hurry (should be departing by now) - I read the article, and I have /dev/ttyUSB{0,1}. Which program would create the interface? pppconfig seems to expect a device being up already.
With NetworkManager (also under Fedora, where it works perfectly), I always get a ppp0 device.
yes-

nice

its better than that

what I never understood: I usually download/dont check/burn/install successfully, never had problems with isos. Guess I was lucky. But my question is: how can a http-download get corrupted, when we have failure correction in TCP?
i set that in xorg.conf personally
actually, I just want to get rid of it
there are server flags in xorg.conf you can set to disable sleep etc tect
i see. Thanks!
http://pastebin.com/sBqw8Kg5
thats mine from my desktop
note the server flags ;)
oh, nice. thanks. vivid: thanks, too. Both: Is it a bug of the GUI? I mean, i set "never"
ive always used xorg.conf I guess I'm too old skool
*grin* I miss old xorg.conf
if you make one, it will be obeyed
too much magic goin on today
exactly :)
sudo find / -iname dropline
takes a while but will find it
alright.
updatedb & locate dont "see" all file systems, right?
alright... i'll check it out... Docteh I was thinking on DPI settings or something
yea. i'll try memorize that phrase of yours
or any other search engine ;)
oh, i almost forgot, that there are some. my bad.
thats why i ALWAYS say websearch. I think the phrase "google it" and suchlike is constrictive and immature
what, you mean xpud?

i am trying to get a better CRT up. It worked, when I just replugged while Karmic was running. After rebooting it wouldnt even use a custom xorg.conf. I now tried fedora, live cd did boot one time in 1600x1200, installed it,. 800x600 max. Reboot to live cd: still 800x600! [...]
xor.conf is obeyed if it exists, just copy the file in and restart the x server, should be ok
the one from the live cd?
if you are using the livecd you can copy over an archived xorg.conf and restart x, it will be used :)
rebooting. thanks meanwhile.
but it does no longer work from the live cd... !!!
then the xorg.conf file isnt right, check /var/log/Xorg.0.log for clues

how can the xorg.cong be not right, when it worked the first time i booted the live cd and after installing (and enabling desktop effects) and rebooting to live cd, it is not broken. There must be something stored in the GPU. They do that, i am 100.0% sure. i tested it with my radeon. they remember stuff. Argh!
try: sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg     then restart x
i will do that after examining the log. thx. sorry for my being strange. trying to get it working for hours now
i feel you dude, had the same in the early days. Kinda why I still use xorg.conf rather than all this automagic stuff
i'd check your xorg.conf dude, you wil probably be able to get away with leaving resolutions out of the screen section if you define the driver and monitor refresh rates etc
we already tried that without success. It worked without that in the beginning. I remain puzzled. Thanks for your help though.
strange stuff dude
I used the kernel parameter "nomodeset" and now xorg.conf takes effect. (Fedora 12, Ubuntu did something with it too, but is still a little bitchy, at least i got 1152xwhaterer)
wtg dude, glas you got the gold :D:D
find . -iname "*.mp3" -exec mv {} /path/to/desk \;

not used it as I understand the find command
i am not _always_ working in the shell. especially not, when i use my computer for mutlimedia stuff
still doesnt stop you using terminal
your "multimedia stuff" doesn't mean the terminal is not to be used in any way
it means opening a new terminal, cding into the folder, etc etc etc
so, if it does the job well then who cares
well is a question of definition and mood, right?
for repeated tasks and such, the terminal is very powerful and should be used
you do not WANT to understand, do you
maybe you arent explaining it well, so far all you have said is you dont want to cd to directories etc.
just use what I said but tweak it
i am indeed using find often, just had a typo. my synergy is killing my clipboard. argh
hehe, make scripts dude, makes life easier
is there a file ~/.aspell.en.pws
no
or similar?
in the gedit plugins there is the spellchecker there. If you click configure are the additional words there?
I can only disable that plugin. Does not look like there was a dictionary in ~ and the word is not in ~/.config/enchant/en_US.dic
retrieve   is the right spelling in british english (Native englishman here)

thank you. It's weird, the other PC has the same version of gedit and can see it as wrong spelling. The "bad" gedit does not mark "retreixyve" as wrong, either, but it marks other words. Any idea what could be going on?
not sure, very weird
oh. Turning off syntax hilighting works, it is a PHP file.
it does only check strings that are actually strings in PHP, but not in the HTML part.
fyi: Switching to HTML solves the problem
